intro: Acer sinense var. concolor, commonly known as the Chinese maple, is a deciduous tree native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive palmate leaves that turn vibrant red in the fall. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers in the spring, followed by samaras with winged seeds. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and prefers well-drained soil. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and urban landscapes.
